org.onyxplatform.api.java

Class OnyxEnv

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.onyxplatform.api.java.OnyxEnv

  • public class OnyxEnv
extends java.lang.Object
    High level functionality and general utilities for environment control, such as peer configuration and environment configuration management, as well as job control (starting, stopping, waiting), and garbage collection. OnyxEnv should be used as an API utility/convenience class, that holds an OnyxEnv object for use in running jobs. **Note** OnyxEnvs contain both EnvConfiguration and PeerConfiguration objects, an OnyxEnv should not be confused with an EnvConfiguration.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OnyxEnv(java.lang.String onyxEnvConfig)
      Constructs a new OnyxEnv object based on a string representing a path to an EDN file (that contains a map specifying environment conditions with keyword value pairs).
      OnyxEnv(java.lang.String onyxEnvConfig, boolean start)
      Constructs a new OnyxEnv object based on a string representing a path to an EDN file (that contains a map specifying environment conditions with keyword value pairs), and a boolean for convenience in automatically starting the environment upon creation.

      • OnyxEnv

        public OnyxEnv(java.lang.String onyxEnvConfig)
        Constructs a new OnyxEnv object based on a string representing a path to an EDN file (that contains a map specifying environment conditions with keyword value pairs).
        Parameters:
        onyxEnvConfig - (string) path to the EDN file containing environment spec

      • OnyxEnv

        public OnyxEnv(java.lang.String onyxEnvConfig,
               boolean start)
        Constructs a new OnyxEnv object based on a string representing a path to an EDN file (that contains a map specifying environment conditions with keyword value pairs), and a boolean for convenience in automatically starting the environment upon creation.
        Parameters:
        onyxEnvConfig - (string) path to the EDN file containing environment spec
        start - boolean specifies whether the environment should start

    • Method Detail

      • applySetupMap

        public OnyxEnv applySetupMap(clojure.lang.IPersistentMap setupMap)
        Constructs a new OnyxEnv object directly from a setup map of type IPersistentMap. The setupMap should contain keyword value pairs directing how the environment should be constructed.
        Parameters:
        setupMap - a map containing keywords and values describing the environment
        Returns:
        new OnyxEnv object

      • generateTenancyId

        public OnyxEnv generateTenancyId()
        Convenience function for generating a unique UUID automatically. The id, called a tenancyId, is used to track Environment and Peer Configurations across job tasks. This method acts on an existing OnyxEnv object.
        Returns:
        the updated OnyxEnv object

      • setTenancyId

        public OnyxEnv setTenancyId(java.lang.Object id)
        Sets the tenancyId of an OnyxEnv object to the specified id object. Returns the updated OnyxEnv object.
        Parameters:
        id - a tenancyId object to associate with the OnyxEnv.
        Returns:
        the updated OnyxEnv object

      • tenancyId

        public java.lang.Object tenancyId()
        Returns the tenancyId object associated with the OnyxEnv object.
        Returns:
        tenancyId object

      • setVirtualPeerCount

        public OnyxEnv setVirtualPeerCount(int vp)
        Sets the virtual peer count of the OnyxEnv object to the specified integer. The number of virtual peers is generally linked to the number of tasks in a job catalog.
        Parameters:
        vp - number of virtualPeers to associate with the OnyxEnv object
        Returns:
        the updated OnyxEnv object

      • virtualPeerCount

        public int virtualPeerCount()
        Returns the number of virtual peers associated with the OnyxEnv object.
        Returns:
        integer number of Virtual peers

        public OnyxEnv setTaskScheduler(TaskScheduler ts)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the updated OnyxEnv object

        public OnyxEnv setEnvConfig(EnvConfiguration ec)

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • loadEnvConfig

        public OnyxEnv loadEnvConfig(java.lang.String envEdn)
        Loads an EnvConfiguration object from a string path to an EDN map file, creating an EnvConfiguration object from that map, and associating it with the OnyxEnv object.
        Parameters:
        envEdn - a string path to the EDN file containing the EnvConfiguration spec
        Returns:
        the updated OnyxEnv object

        Stops the OnyxEnv object.
        Returns:

      • gc

        public boolean gc()
        Garbage collects on an OnyxEnv (cleans up log, removes orphaned peers, etc). For more documentation, see the Onyx Docs.
        Returns:
        true unless an exception happens while garbage collecting

      • submitJob

        public clojure.lang.IPersistentMap submitJob(Job job)
        Submits the specified job object using the OnyxEnv object. The OnyxEnv must be started to successfully run the Job.
        Parameters:
        job - Job object to be run in the started OnyxEnv object
        Returns:
        a map of the started job if successful

      • submitAsyncJob

        public clojure.lang.IPersistentMap submitAsyncJob(Job job,
                                                  clojure.lang.PersistentVector inputs)
        Submits the specified job object as an asynchronous job, which binds the given inputs segments (a PersistentVector of inputs) to core-async channels via the AsyncLifecycles utility. If successful, returns a map of the started job.
        Parameters:
        job - Job object to be run in the started OnyxEnv object
        inputs - PersistentVector of inputs to be bound to the job asynchronously
        Returns:
        a map of the started job if successful

      • submitAsyncJob

        public clojure.lang.IPersistentMap submitAsyncJob(Job job,
                                                  OnyxVector inputs)
        Submits the specified job object as an asynchronous job, which binds the given inputs segments (a PersistentVector of inputs) to core-async channels via the AsyncLifecycles utility. If successful, returns a map of the started job.
        Parameters:
        job - Job object to be run in the started OnyxEnv object
        inputs - OnyxVector of inputs to be bound to the Job asynchronously
        Returns:
        a map of the started job if successful

      • killJob

        public boolean killJob(clojure.lang.IPersistentMap jobMetadata)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Uses an IPersistentMap of Job data (metadata) which contains a keyword reference to the job-id to kill a currently running job.
        Parameters:
        jobMetadata - IPersistentMap containing a keyword linked to the current job id.
        Returns:
        a true/false status of job kill effort
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the job cannot be killed returns false

      • awaitJobCompletion

        public boolean awaitJobCompletion(clojure.lang.IPersistentMap jobMetadata)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        Uses an IPersistentMap of Job data (metadata) which contains a keyword reference to the job-id to wait for a currently running job to finish before continuing with the next code block.
        Parameters:
        jobMetadata - IPersistentMap containing a keyword linked to the current job id.
        Returns:
        a true/false status of job completion
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the job cannot wait (wait attempt failed) returns false
